member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Agent
member.summary: Base abstraction for all Semantic Kernel agents. An agent instance may participate in one or more conversations, or . A conversation may include one or more agents.
member.remarks: In addition to identity and descriptive meta-data, an must define its communication protocol, or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Agent.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the agent (optional).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Agent.Id
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the agent (optional).
member.value: The identifier of the agent. The default is a random GUID value, but that can be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Agent.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the agent (optional).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Agent.GetChannelKeys
member.summary:
Set of keys to establish channel affinity. Minimum expected key-set:
yield return typeof(YourAgentChannel).FullName;
member.remarks: Two specific agents of the same type may each require their own channel. This is why the channel type alone is insufficient. For example, two OpenAI Assistant agents each targeting a different Azure OpenAI endpoint would require their own channel. In this case, the endpoint could be expressed as an additional key.

member.param: The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: An appropriate for the agent type.
member.remarks: Every agent conversation, or , will establish one or more objects according to the specific type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChannel.InvokeAsync(Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Agent,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Perform a discrete incremental interaction between a single and .
member.param: The agent actively interacting with the chat.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: Asynchronous enumeration of messages.
member.remarks: In the enumeration returned by this method, a message is considered visible if it is intended to be displayed to the user. Example of a non-visible message is function-content for functions that are automatically executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChat
member.summary: Provides a point of interaction for one or more agents.
member.remarks: instances don't support concurrent invocation and will throw an exception if concurrent activity is attempted for any public method.

member.summary: Gets the agents participating in the chat.

member.remarks: instances don't support concurrent invocation and will throw exception if concurrent activity is attempted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChat.AddChatMessage(Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ChatMessageContent)
member.summary: Appends a message to the conversation. Adding a message while an agent is active is not allowed.
member.param: A non-system message to append to the conversation.
member.remarks:
Adding a message to the conversation requires that any active remains synchronized, so the message is broadcast to all channels.
instances don't support concurrent invocation and will throw exception if concurrent activity is attempted.
member.exception: A system message is present, and no other action is taken.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChat.AddChatMessages(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ChatMessageContent})
member.summary: Appends messages to the conversation. Adding messages while an agent is active is not allowed.
member.param: A set of non-system messages to append to the conversation.
member.remarks:
Adding messages to the conversation requires that any active remains synchronized, so the messages are broadcast to all channels.
instances don't support concurrent invocation and will throw exception if concurrent activity is attempted.
member.exception: A system message is present, and no other action is taken. -or- The chat has current activity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChat.ResetAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resets the chat, clearing all history and persisted state. All agents will remain present.
member.param: The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChat.ClearActivitySignal
member.summary: Clear activity signal to indicate that activity has ceased.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.AgentChat.SetActivityOrThrow
member.summary: Checks to ensure the chat is not concurrently active and throws an exception if it is. If not, activity is signaled.
member.remarks: Rather than allowing concurrent invocation to result in undefined behavior or failure, it's preferred to fail fast to avoid side effects or state mutation. The activity signal is used to manage ability and visibility for taking actions based on conversation history.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Internal.BroadcastQueue
member.summary: Utility class used by to manage the broadcast of conversation messages via the . Interaction occurs via two methods: - : Adds messages to a channel specific queue for processing. - : Blocks until the specified channel's processing queue is empty.
member.remarks: Maintains a set of channel specific queues, each with individual locks. Queue specific locks exist to synchronize access to an individual queue only. Due to the closed "friend" relationship between with , is never invoked concurrently, which eliminates race conditions over the queue dictionary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Internal.BroadcastQueue.BlockDuration
member.summary: Defines the yield duration when waiting on a channel-queue to synchronize and drain.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Internal.BroadcastQueue.Enqueue(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Agents.Internal.ChannelReference},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ChatMessageContent})
member.summary: Enqueue a set of messages for a given channel.
member.param: The target channels for which to broadcast.
The messages being broadcast.

member.summary: Blocks until a channel-queue is not in a receive state to ensure that channel history is complete.
member.param: A structure.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: false when channel is no longer receiving.
member.throws: When channel is out of sync.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.ModelDiagnostics
member.summary: Model diagnostics helper class that provides a set of methods to trace model activities with the OTel semantic conventions. This class contains experimental features and may change in the future. To enable these features, set one of the following switches to true: `Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Experimental.GenAI.EnableOTelDiagnostics` `Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Experimental.GenAI.EnableOTelDiagnosticsSensitive` Or set the following environment variables to true: `SEMANTICKERNEL_EXPERIMENTAL_GENAI_ENABLE_OTEL_DIAGNOSTICS` `SEMANTICKERNEL_EXPERIMENTAL_GENAI_ENABLE_OTEL_DIAGNOSTICS_SENSITIVE`

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.ModelDiagnostics.IsModelDiagnosticsEnabled
member.summary: Check if model diagnostics is enabled Model diagnostics is enabled if either EnableModelDiagnostics or EnableSensitiveEvents is set to true and there are listeners.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.ModelDiagnostics.IsSensitiveEventsEnabled
member.summary: Check if sensitive events are enabled. Sensitive events are enabled if EnableSensitiveEvents is set to true and there are listeners.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Verify.AsciiLettersDigitsUnderscoresRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[0-9A-Za-z_]*$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match a character in the set [0-9A-Z_a-z] atomically any number of times.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Verify.FilenameRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[^.]+\\.[^.]+$
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match a character other than '.' atomically at least once.
Match '.'.
Match a character other than '.' greedily at least once.
Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.AppContextSwitchHelper
member.summary: Helper class to get app context switch value

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.AppContextSwitchHelper.GetConfigValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified app switch or environment variable if it is set. If the switch or environment variable is not set, return false. The app switch value takes precedence over the environment variable.
member.param: The name of the app switch.
The name of the environment variable.
member.returns: The value of the app switch or environment variable if it is set; otherwise, false.
